skills.name: backend
skills.text:
I run my applications on go or node.js servers, inside a container on my own hardware and/or cloud space. I have extensive experience in backend setup, both linux and more general networking/firewalls/containerization/virtualization.

A short description of my homelab setup: 
Hardware:	HP ProLiant ML350p, 2 Xeon E5, 64Gb ram
Operating system:	CentOS 8
CentOS is a headless server acting purely as a hypervisor, ontop of which I run multiple VM's, usually cloned from a base thin lvm image. One production VM (CentOS) is exposed to internet, others are for development (Fedora) and a single gitlab runner (CoreOS). Firewall is configured with nftables and Firewalld, access to development VM's via wireguard or lan and ssh. All development VM's are run on separate nat networks, production VM is run on a routed network. You can see some details in the helper scripts located in the kvm-scripts repository. All software in production is run on podman.

skills.name: frontend
skills.text: I have sold, made and delivered multiple websites for customers, custom build from scratch using Angular. Most of my experience is with Angular framework, but I am excited to learn new frameworks or use pure javascript. I am particularly proud of the code that generates this CV, check it out!

skills.name: sql
skills.text: I have used mariadb in the past as a database, lately usage is limited to linking mariadb official container to other solutions such as matomo, wordpress and mattermost using podman pods. While I am not currently proficient with mysql, I feel confident in my ability to work with it as well as design and implement a database.

skills.name: linux
skills.text: I have run Linux computers for over 10 years. Started from Mint/Ubuntu then installed Arch from scratch. Since then I have obsessively improved my knowledge and skills with Linux systems, currently running CentOS on my home lab and Fedora for development servers and laptop. I have fairly extensive knowledge of internals, ranging from ssh/gpg to systemd and kernel modules.

skills.name: virtualization
skills.text: I use kvm/libvirt via virsh to operate my homelab containing a production vm, multiple development vm's and a cicd runner.

skills.name: docker/podman
skills.text: I use both docker and podman extensively. I have also automated procedures using docker api, and more recently buildah. Many of my projects include container images available in the corresponding gitlab repositories container registry. My self-hosted production code all reside in a container on top of podman. I also have some, albeit very limited, experience with kubernetes.

skills.name: cicd
skills.text: Primarily use gitlab cicd with a self-hosted runner, but have also used github cicd for its pages.

skills.name: testing
skills.text: Testing reduces work when implementing new features and maintaining code. I do my best to create tests as often as possible.

skills.name: git
skills.text: I use git primarily from commandline. Gitlab for development(for its issue's and cicd) and mirror to github my public/open repos. I have some experience with the features of all three, including self-hosting pure-git and gitlab(very limited). I also use both gitlab-python api and github octokit for automating many of my git operations.

skills.name: networking
skills.text: I know the basics of networking and firewalls. This consists of an understanding (and a fair amount of practical experience) of routing (ip rule, route, netns), iptables/nftables and a very basic understanding of networking layers. I am also extremely familiar with troubleshooting with nmap, traceroute and wireshark/tshark.

skills.name: data-science
skills.text: Done online courses on signal processing(EPFL DSP course) and machine learning (Andrew Ng), although I only know the very bare basics and have limited experience. However, I am eager to learn more should the opportunity arise.

text:
A passionate coder and computer enthusiast, I started my adult career studying for a Bachelor Programme in International Business at Aalto university. After my university years I found my love for computers and eventually, coding. Since then I have spent the majority of my time coding or tweaking Linux systems, I particularly enjoy learning new computer skills and consider myself adept at quickly picking up programming languages, libraries and frameworks. While my strengths lie in backend, I have also built websites (which I have seld, made and delivered to corporate customers) and dabbled in data analysis such as discrete Fourier transform and machine learning. My years of business studies and running a single-person company (I imported and sold industrial parts in Finland) have also given me a solid understanding of finance, sales and customer service. Additionally they have made me a very social person who enjoys working with others and isn't afraid of public speaking. Before all this I spent my formative years in Spain, before moving to Finland at the age of 8. This has given me a multicultural outlook on life as well as a native speaker dominance of Finnish, Spanish and English. Of these, by far my strongest language is English, having been in English-speaking environments since kindergarten. In my free time I like to read, climb, scuba-dive (not so often in Finland) or go camping. Nevertheless, my true leisure time love would have to be good food.

	If you are looking for a motivated and social coder who isn't afraid of learning new skills, here I am.
